Their Honey Wine definitely has its very sweet taste, making it a stronger creeper(at least to me it was). Very nicely decorated place. Very friendly services. Jazz band plays on Saturday nights, making it a very romantic setting. :]

rQU1e31on09b3ptVcEtDEQ.review_text: I really like Sheba Lounge. Note that if you are going just for Ethiopian food, there are certainly better places out there. However the lounge environment along with the excellent cocktails and low-key vibe make this restaurant a really cool hang-out. I personally recommend the Red Sea (fancy name for a bloody mary) which definitely has a kick to it. By way of food, we sampled the Mesir Wat (lentils) and the Beg Alecha (lamb). Both were flavorful and plenty spicy. Make sure you eat some of the salad they serve on the side. The dressing is awesome. The place itself is on the smaller side, but they do take reservations. Once you get in, they have tables as well as lounge-style couches where you can eat. It's a cozy place to be on a Saturday night.

ior7exTVZ8dxJUkTJAYKEQ.review_text: I LOVE this place!  The owners are terrific, and treat you like a VIP!  The ambiance is warm and laid back, and there is always good music playing (either live music or good CD's).  The drinks and food are reasonably priced for this type of environment.  Overall, it has been a GREAT addition to the neighborhood!

LSR-7DBaBp0lgfh6KN6j9g.review_text: Delicious, homey, rustic food and nice jazz.

bLLpAJ5ia_Bq170E0jZdOQ.review_text: Who would think that the Fillmore's premiere Ethiopian restaurant would be called the SHEBA PIANO LOUNGE?  LOL  Although the food at SHEBA's is well made, the Ethiopian entrees tend to lack the "spicy kick" of other well known Ethiopian restaurants in the Bay (most notable Addis and others). However, the chill decor and excellent service will quickly make you forget the blandness of the food.   In addition, unlike other restaurants, SHEBA LOUNGE will actually encourage your group NOT to sit at one of the FEW dinner tables, but inside eat dinner with your group on one of the many couches located throughout the joint.   One word of warning. SHEBA LOUNGE is small... So I would highly recommend reservations if you plan to come with a large group anytime after six pm.

zAFS5GwqdQH9ZlwgL5ywAQ.review_text: My fam was in town last weekend, and whaddya know??? They'd never tried Ethiopian food.  It's never too late to learn something new about your loved ones :)  Sheba Lounge was a natural choice for the mature ambiance and live music.  I'd been several times before and it's a great choice for Ethiopian food and / or cocktails on the low-key tip.  I sense that they're going for a sophisticated atmosphere.   I have to be real though, in comparison to the restaurant scene in San Francisco, I'd offer Sheba a 3.5 (I'm being nice rounding up to 4).  The service is seriously spotty.  We were seated with no menus for about 10 minutes.  They served our appetizers and entrees (which included pasta) without silverware.  Aside from the mystique--and veggie friendliness--of Ethiopian food, the food itself really doesn't stand out.  Desserts are just ok.    Besides all of that, Sheba Lounge really keeps me coming back for the music.  Good eats with background music is always a treat!

2o5GDOxLcQK35AbDwoodCQ.review_text: Definitely a plus that they have a fireplace. The food is quite good, if not stellar. The cocktails are not great.  Something about this place is just off. It's not a wonderfully diarrhea-inducing Ethiopian restaurant, and yet it's not a smoky bar where I can sip whiskey and listen to blues, either. It's just in some weird purgatory.

FeyS3G1KCtapwfiMymehlg.review_text: Slow service. Mediocre food at best.  However, the atmosphere is nice.

F87HSYDJv0Qxv9CjR54H6g.review_text: Yes, great food for sure. ABOVE ALL, THOUGH, you will not find a place with this classic ambience of a cafe-restaurant. This is a jazzy speak-easy of old. Great decor, spots for private chat over coffee, tea, or a tasty drink. Don't hesitate: a great place for a quiet informal time for food, jazz, and chat.

eS7XvREtzjf8XRM_O1jOGg.review_text: I went here on the advice of some new friends I made after seeing Bedouin Soundclash open for Hot Hot Heat at the Fillmore. It was just one of those epic nights where I went out by myself to see a band I knew would kick ass and ended up making a bunch of friends and having an amazing time. I didn't have time to eat before the show, and when we got to Sheba they were about to close the kitchen. We were drunk and hungry, but the one plate of spongey Ethiopian bread and whatever that beef lentil grub was more than enough for me and my friend. We had all the drinks we could handle and more, the bartender guy and owner, a woman named Israel, were very attentive. We ended up relaxing by the fire with some red wine and passing around the guitar for entertainment. They stayed open extra late for us, and that was greatly appreciated. It was just one of those nights that I will never forget. Thanks Sheba!

f9xHtDot9Yjqalc1x_8-0g.review_text: I had never tried Ethiopia food before this pace.  When I heard they played live jazz, I thought too good to be true.  Thank goodness that it wasnt.  The place is large, so feel free to come with many friends.  The server was very good at what she did.   I loved every bit of my foot and the music was excellent.  The only "complaint" (more that I felt bad for the band) was the light behind them that was faulty. It kept flickering, which annoyed them to no end. They kept their cool and kept rocking (it eventually worked properly.)  Thank you Nadja M for recommending this place. Cant wait to go back!

vQqX5xI6rrtzdeVKt1knIQ.review_text: great for the night life people who would like to relax and listen to good live music under dim lights. The ambiance of this place is incredible, and its in a really nice safe area.  Plane and simply, AWESOME =)

vKGAp0LYXsYR5z5o2QYEvw.review_text: I love the Sheba Lounge this is a fav spot of mine the mood is chill and the service is great!!  I have typically been on a Sunday, since its my fav day of the week .  But I have been other nights love when they have live music, also good musicians.  I like their twist on the Ethiopian food has a bit of western flare.  I always go for the Lentil and Pita chips and sambussas.  The drinks are yummy too!!  Its a great place for groups or a date.  I have so many great memories here and I will continue to hang out there and build more memories

h8i7niFeyo589fPg91CbNQ.review_text: I have been here a few times but mostly on weekends. Ambiance is great and as always Ethiopian food has good vegetarian options. Ambiance is 8/10, Food is 8/10 (Points cut as no eggless dessert and no Shiro Wat) and service is 8/10 (the waitress kept coming back too quickly repeatedly for taking the order) . Music was average on a weekday but much better on fri / sat night. Great place for a date / romantic dinner.

_7S3M4_YK5tKZYMpe-eHMg.review_text: The food was good.  Pretty good, actually.   Had the lentil and crab sambussas.   The spicy fries were a bit too spicy for most of us, but tasted good and seemed fresh. The drunken chicken drummettes were very good. The TQ (quinoa with turkey meat balls) were delicious and different.  The ambiance was nice, dim lights, nice decor.  The music was...  a bit too mellow for me. Good musicians, but i would have preferred something more upbeat.    The service, however, was poor.  We got there when there were only a couple of tables occupied but still the waiter took forever to notice us, get our orders, bring our food.  Then it was packed and it got worse.  Three times my friend had to go find the waiter because he (yes, there was only one waiter plus the owner) was nowhere to be found: 1: so that we could order our food.  2: so that we could get more drinks.  3: so that we could pay the bill.  Pretty bad service.  If it weren't for this, and the fact that i was bummed that they didn't have iced tea or Anchor Steam (In SF!!!),  and the fact that their orange juice tasted like Sunny D, i would have given it 4 stars.    But Sheba Piano Lounge, after tonight, you do not deserve 4 stars.

rkZF6cdHz7njcUR5oc4s9A.review_text: Amazing ambience, great food, great live music! My wife and I love music and I took her here to celebrate her birthday. Was wonderful!

5EIvKCMVYetZ37Q5f-wifQ.review_text: Very chill and comfortable atmosphere. Delectable mohitos. I hear there is a piano man there on a regular basis. Check it!

zhEA8KshixsqftezA2ayOA.review_text: SHEBA are you KIDDING?! The food was AWFUL and it came out extremely slow. I have been to 2 Ethiopian restaurants previously in OAKLAND (and many more elsewhere) and they were 100X more authentic and better. The quality was really bad. I went here with a friend on a saturday night and we ordered lamb. it took us a REALLY long time to get the food and when it came the meat was grade D. My friend spit it out, and I thought it was okay, until a few bites later and got the worst cut of meat i've ever been served in a restaurant. it was 100% fatty and mostly tendons. The hostess asked us how things were going and when we said "truthfully, dissatisfied" she acted like she thought we were insulting her. I don't think many of the other customers noticed the bad food or service. it seemed like they were on first dates OR they had never had ethiopian before, as i saw that the waitress had to explain to people how to eat the food. they gave out forks and spoons, and i saw one guy spooning his dish into the bread. Tsk tsk tsk.

v81_ENy3Gb_Q9qC7_o3hVw.review_text: I love this place because, unlike in other jazz clubs, the music is not too loud so you can still talk. It's a cozy jazz lounge with good music, good food and drinks. Ok service (so it would actually be 4.5 stars).

skar1XyXyjTKKUawy-NlyA.review_text: I've been to Sheba lounge at least 5 times and always have a great time, which is probably why I am bumping it up from what might otherwise be a 4 to a 5.     On the pro side, the food is just delicious.  We always order the vegetarian sampler, and then the chicken tibs, and share between two.  Perfect amount of spice, and everything is so tasty.  (It's delicious as leftovers too).  Our friends get the split pea and the chicken wat.  We all just love the food.  We also really enjoy having good live jazz playing while we eat and relax - the jazz is always good.  We normally sit in the lounge chairs which is a bit less convenient for food but very convenient for the jazz, but this last time we sat at a table and it was a lot easier for eating!  (random note, we also ended up sitting next to Danny Glover last night)  And overall the ambience is really relaxed, comfortable, dim, and very intimate.    On the con side, we try the wine every time, and I am sad to say that we never enjoy it.  Last night, we finally gave up and I ordered the champagne cocktail while my friends all ordered the stella, and we were much happier.  I really do wish the wine selection was better.  Second, because of the jazz playing right next to you, this is not a place where it is easy to have a group conversation because it's quite loud.  But if a conversation is your first priority, a jazz lounge probably shouldn't be!

h12u66eBgpLFYmcwnWlFqg.review_text: Cool little joint. We arrived for dinner at 8pm on a Friday and got seated right away. Nice atmosphere and very laid back. The food is ethiopian which basically means no silverware and you grab your food with this spongy sort of bread. It was really tasty.   Things got even cooler when the live band started playing around 9pm. Wish we could've stayed longer for the music but we were going to a show at yoshi's (right down the block). Definitely would go back for a night of live music.

sUIA5VSx_6y39mez8J41OA.review_text: Came here on a Saturday night, starving. The menu proudly advertises the fact that they have an "authentic Ethiopian chef" . Well that's wonderful....but it took that one chef over an hour to bring us 2 dishes. The drinks were mediocre to decent at best but the food is more of a novelty. The two positives: the atmosphere was cool and the live jazz band was awesome. Other than that, nothing redeeming about this restaurant. Not going back.

E-Sgmcl3VfDAVG-04e5ldw.review_text: Addis Champagne Cocktail  GoJam Red Sea Nile Collins Try all those drinks. You won't be disappointed.  LIVE Jazz Band was beyond gr8! They were jamming from beginning to end. They were so cool because they started playing one song that a guest liked and she hopped up and asked if she could get on the guitar cause she could play and they let her and she jammed with them on that one song. Real cool atmosphere, mixed crowd, nice lounge, attentive staff.

2feX-HoiFo0XAKemgKxlTw.review_text: We came here after leaving Rassela's for a more low-key place so we could have conversation. I couldn't believe there were TWO restaurants on the same block that play jazz and serve Ethiopian food. Weird. Anyways, they were really nice and the place had a good vibe. We didn't have any food as we just ate, but the drinks were good and the music was at a nice level to sit and have a conversation.

Kq76QfkJppxN_btvvi0FbQ.review_text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this spot...   Did I say LOVE IT!!    OMG!  I enjoy really good Ethiopian food.  I used to go to a spot in Bekeley years ago and when I moved to Campbell I made it to a few spots and just never hit my pallet right.   Well looked this place up hear on YELP... Went Sat night for my friends B-Day and this palce is soo chill.  We sat in lounge chairs and where erved out food and drinks while the Jazz musicians played to us..   BTW we where facing dorectly to them so I felt they where playing for her B-day !!  A litttle fantasy never hurts  Any hew the food was soo freakin delish. . We ordered a Vegetarian Platter with Doro Tibbs on top    IT was do fliipin goodthat y friend is is very picky in ehat she eats, who I though wouldnt even make it through the course of them meal wanted me to order a second round of Doro tibbs...   I always take her places I enjoy to widen her spectrum AND SHE LOVED IT  You have to go once to make you decision but man I will be back even if I have to drive from Campbell

3PDbYcLe2d8gbTzSEn_1Kg.review_text: The food was delicious however the seating was a little bit of a predicament.  We were moved to another table because apparently it was reserved for a party which was kind of a bummer since the seats we were in were much more comfy.  The food is fairly good and so were my cocktails.  We shared a combination meat plate (not on the menu you have to request it) and tiramisu for dessert.  One gripe is that I wished they had moist towelettes available because my fingers were disgusting after I ate.  My cocktail was a spicy watermelon carpiranha and it was unlike anything I've ever tried.  It's sweet but definitely has a kick to it.  The band was jammin out to their neo soul/jazz tunes.  This place has a cool vibe and its very intimate.  Don't know if I'll be retuning back because I don't want to deal with the tight seating arrangement.

ZWvT-oJCV9rLfjmSTchVUQ.review_text:
This place has a nice quiet atmosphere, a great place to have conversation. They even had some background jazz music to put you in a good mood. I went here last night with a couple of my girlfriends. I ordered the Sheba burger. It was different. I couldnt believe they charged me a dollar for cheese. Oh well. All entrees are reasonably priced. The waitress was very friendly. I also had fun dining here because I was able to watch the Giants game. Too bad they lost. Crap!! 
  *Dodgers suck*

Xorep_PXj9XQH3UVquaZAA.review_text: Great place to stop by before or after a show at Yoshi's. Seemed to have a lot of industry people that stopped on by which I always like. Very friendly service and the nice place for small groups to get together and have a cocktail. Would like to go back and try the food. God I love the Fillmore.

Jbknyz1PoOPaMilkoP9ilw.review_text: The atmosphere of the restaurant was very classy, but I felt strange walking in and having the piano and the rest of the band, who was right by the front door, turn to look at me. I felt as though I walked on stage during a performance.   The lighting was dim and I could barely see the menu or the people I sat with, and was also a bit disappointed that the tables weren't arranged so that the band was a focus. From my view, the piano was blocking all the band members - unfortunate. The music itself was beautiful, though.  We ordered a lamb dish, a veggie dish with collard greens, and baklava. The lamb was a bit too chunky to be eaten with your hands; it was also a bit tough. The collard greens with potatoes were delicious. Service was great, however.  Would go back next time but will be making reservations for the green couches so I can see the band!

c21C3o0lzdbFaUlT76CSNg.review_text: This is quietly one of the best places on Fillmore. Shhh. The Ethiopian cuisine is delicious and the vibe is sweet.

xfgwCFEQG-xf15zrT6oCgw.review_text: In the middle of this coziest and most beautiful of lounges is a re-creation of the wall of the Church of Lalibela in Ethiopia. Many people might not even quite notice that or take it in - there's a lot of other comfy, beautiful things going on in Sheba.  Lalibela Church came up just short of making it onto the list of Seven World Wonders, but its magnificence is due to the fact that it was sculpted out of one rock - a major engineering feat in the 12th century.  And the Sheba Lounge has the essence of that special place. WIth its fireplace, sunken couches, fabulous cocktails, it is THE place to relax on a Friday night after work. And you can't beat the great tri-continental cuisine.  But the most wonderful thing about the Sheba Lounge is its owner - Netsanet - a queen herself! Netsanet lives to entertain and offer people a warm, relaxing, good time. I held my spouse's graduation party here and - if you want to be treated like royalty, have Netsanet cater your party. She is eminently talented and so generous!  The Sheba Lounge is a special place. I only wish I lived closer so I could make it over there more often.

9TU7N1iM3mTY9OcZJhpv0g.review_text: My bf took me here for Valentine's day. I was excited to try Ethiopian food especially since our old roommate was Ethiopian. We ordered sambussa, which was like an spicy eggroll, the vegetarian platter, which had an array of vegetables and salads, and the doro tibs, which is a delicious stewed meat. I really enjoyed the environment of jazz music, dim lights and yummy food. The hostess even took the time to teach us how to eat with our hands. I definitely like the culture and food.

rvxxmHFLzY911MMubS45jQ.review_text: My boyfriend and I decided to try out the Sheba Lounge Saturday night. When we got there there weren't any open tables yet, so we waited in this little area that was like a living room. We sat on this comfy furniture in front of a fireplace. My boyfriend thought it was roasting in there, but if you're cold all the time like me....you will think it's cozy. I LOVED it!  While sitting there we got a beer and to my suprise it was only $4.00!! That's exciting!   Then, we got to our table, and the waitress was very nice. We had never eaten Ethiopian food before. I got the vegetarian sampler, and my boyfriend got the Sirlion Wat (something like that). The waitress showed us how to eat it and you take a piece of the bread stuff and pick up the food with it. It was a fun and DELICIOUS meal!! We both loved it, and will totally go back!  The atmosphere was great, too. Very comfotable and relaxing.   Now....of course a lot of people like Sheba because it's a piano bar. When we were there they had a jaz group (no piano). They were really, really, awesome! I loved listening to them.   Perfect date place!! Loved it!!

mrHhLlan657ynlkKhYNm-Q.review_text: Stopped in here with a group of six for a nightcap and jazz on a Tuesday night after dinner at 1300 on Filmore.  I read about it on Yelp and thought it would be a great place to end the evening with a little jazz..  Good planning is everything... we arrived at 10:30pm and the music had ended at 10pm.  That's just too early to shut down the party!   So, we opted to go somewhere else.  It looks like a nice place to hang out, and I imagine its great with live music.    I'll check the timing on the music venue next time, and will try again because it looks like a cool place.

X0P_BeJgfj-rfqUY6Ljq_A.review_text: We love Ethiopian food. And when we were in the area, and a piano lounge to boot, we had to try it out. We got the vegetarian sampler - which was delicious. And the vibe was very different from other Ethiopian restaurants that we have been to - very chic and dimly lit. Unfortunately we couldn't stick around for the music, since we had to head off to the Fillmore for a concert. But definitely plan on coming back to check it out.   ps: By dimly lit, I mean really really dimly lit - so be sure to carry a flashlight :).

ftqKNw6BbcEqT6eQCDzupg.review_text: On my last review I said I was going here for New Year's Eve and I did. So this review is for that event only and not for it's regular days (which I still give it 4 stars for).   Anyway, I called them the night before to ask what their cover charge was for New Year's Eve. The guy on the phone told me $20 for just drinks and music and $50 for their dinner set. Ok, a little more than last year but I still went. When I got there with my bf, cover charge was only $10. Great! But all their seats were reserved for either dinner or other guests and the hostess told us we can chill at the bar...but all the bar seats were filled so what do we do? Just stand around? They didn't really have a standing around atmosphere. The hostess did try to offer us many options, like seating us temporarily at the reserved spots until the people came, but I didn't want to have to get up once I got comfie, so we left. Met up with some friends then came back, but this time the hostess just gave us the reserved seats right away and told us she'd have the people who reserved the seats sit somewhere else when they came. Cool!   They had a really good blues band playing, but was A LOT louder than the band they had last year, so it was really hard to have conversations with people who weren't sitting right next to you. actually had a pretty nice server that night, but she dropped and broke a glass right in front of my friends and didn't bother sweeping it up (she just picked up the big pieces). She didn't apologize or ask if anyone got hurt (the glass actually did bounce and hit my friends. Thought that was a little irresponsible of her.   Later near the countdown they passed out party favors (hats, blowers, masks) and champagne. Wish they passed out the favors a little earlier so we could've played around with them and taken pictures a little more. They also gave out champagne.   All in all it was a fun night with great, but a little loud, music. They just didn't seem very prepared for the crowd and "unexpected" people who didn't have reservations.

prDIzYC5FhN90ELcmeTlkA.review_text: Cute Ethiopian place with relatively good food. I liked most of their meat dishes and their vegetarian stuff was good as well. We ordered family style and the portion size was more on the skimpy side but that's okay. The taste was good, and our waitress was nice. Parking wasn't too difficult either, which is always a great find.

2nn7CyYHUPbK-Op8bO3iDA.review_text: Great, unconventional Ethiopian restaurant. The lounge seating takes some getting used to, when you are seated for dinner. We tried several items on the menu. Recommend the Pita Crisp with Spicy Lentil dip and Spinach dip....we re-ordered the lentil dip. I was looking forward to trying the okra appetizer, and was pleasantly surprised when we were told the restaurant wasn't serving it as okra wasn't in season....extra star for using fresh, in-season produce! The Misir wat (lentils) and fresh carrots/cabbage/potatoes entrees were good. They serve the injera on the side , and not on the large plate like most traditional Ethiopian restaurants. The international lounge music playing in the background was much better than the live music. To be fair, the restaurant wasn't that busy on a Thursday evening and the musician seemed happy to chat instead with folks who looked like they were regulars. Overall, great food, decent sized portions, friendly service, and the place has a nice vibe. I'd go back.

DES4ag_Kbi0ENRu9YVn23A.review_text: Have had better Ethiopian food than this! Can't wait to try other restaurants.

B7_RGasesvWsz4vE4_eoPA.review_text: Great live music with a cozy atmosphere.  If you're in the mood for wonderful jazz on a Friday or Saturday night, this is the place to be.  The place has a crowded bar and a less crowded lounge area.  The food was mediocre but the music more than made up for it.  Drinks are decent.  The neighboring area is lively and offers alternatives before or after your visit.

LgXjPILKDkEHxSiaCaDP0g.review_text: UPDATE...  This place is now on my Sh-t List.  I booked a birthday party for 20+ peeps here, confirmed it, everything.  They call me 2 days before the party to tell me they double booked.  The stoned sounding OWNER didn't offer anything and just blamed it on her sister.  She said she would call me back later and we hung up.  Stunned and disgusted, I immediately booked another location quickly and called her back to tell her to forget about me.  IT WAS SO UNPROFESSIONAL.  If I ran my business that way - I'd have no business.

9jlgUwO_oIaYWTKNdI9zkg.review_text: pros : ingira was nice . food was good too. doro tibs :) . cons: extremely slow service. It took like an hour to get the order. Asked for a glass of water , the waitress replied it would take few minutes to get the water . I  had to get up myself and get the water from the bar. They didnt had enough chairs for our group too. Music is extremely loud if you sit next to the band.  I liked zenis more , in san jose though.

AtoDIsk5vEcIIXJqPp-PLQ.review_text: Very cool place to chill, jazz music, pretty good food, great environment and service.

faKT8y30vYr3MKSIdoeDGw.review_text: This place is awesome. As simple as that. It's slightly different from the Ethiopian food I'm used to from Los Angeles. The spice was there but it wasn't as saucy. Either way, it was different but GOOD. The one thing I don't like about restaurants in LA is the cleasiness. I go in and feel like I need my dose of Purell. But Sheba Lounge was sooo clean and the style of the restaurant was quaint, comfy and chic. I was taken surprised and looking forward to trying the food. The service was great and quick! I was starving, so my friend and I stuffed the food down the minute it came. Delicious! The owner even came by to ask how we were enjoying the food. I like it when the owners ask and make sure their customers are happy. It shows some sense that they care about their business. So all and all, definitely a 4 stars. Maybe I'll up it to a 5 the second time I go and have more time to sample more dishes  and experience the lounge.

gz1d-EASJ1fNf3qPxbREjw.review_text: This beautiful lounge has such a relaxing atmosphere it makes you want to throw on some PJ's and just snuggle!  The fireplace is nice and toasty and the decor is warm.   Live entertainment is always great.  The food is sooooo good.  I recommend staring off with a glass of honey wine and sirloin sambussa for an appetizer they are to die for!   Anything on the menu is good but my favorites are the Rosemary Balsamic Seabass or the Durotibs (sp).    You'll love the host and everything about the place.

_pOpUZI7gx3jMAiiFcGu-Q.review_text: Food (when available) was delicious. We were just a little upset that they were out of two of our four choices and didn't let us know in the first place...  Atmosphere was nice even though a little loud with the jazz band and the saxophone. But the quality of the music made up for it. Overall good experience but a little disappointed.

k4OdaJT9o5-LtbPCe7nlkw.review_text: Visited Sheba Lounge on a Friday night around 9:30pm.  The restaurant/lounge was pretty full, so we were seated by the door right by the jazz band. We were so close that it felt like a personal concert. Super cool!  We ordered the steak sambusas, vegetarian combination, and the Doro Wat (daily special) for dinner. The food took forever to come out and the vegetarian combo was cold when it arrived. The Doro Wat was AMAZING though.   The food was probably 3 stars, but I bumped Sheba up to a four because of the awesome music and the killer Doro Wat.

ZBvgdepd6a_eRL9100jnvQ.review_text: Just went back with the fiance and friends. Be sure to check out the drinks menu.

qTGlSrvoH8v84d0mSEwiQQ.review_text: came here for a drink with a girl friend of mine.  sadly we couldn't really talk over the loud music.

qPIZf7jV5sCH0r17YUF7eg.review_text: Great food, great music, comfy place.  We had fun playing guess that song with the pianist who was playing his rendition of Top 40. He transitioned from song to song really well.   The food and drinks are quite tasty. I'd say in comparison to other Ethiopian places with just as good foods the portions are small for the price, but you definitely pay for the swanky atmosphere.  Remember, just because you're at a piano bar doesn't mean you don't eat with your hands!  Overall, fun place.

hFGYC-wjaZCSuhMdO8K_Tw.review_text: I went to Sheba's to celebrate my sixth 18th birthday, and I am so glad I chose this spot. My main reason for subtracting a star was the music. The live music was supposed to start at 9 (according to the hostess), but I didn't get going until late 9ish-10. So my party and I only got to enjoy about 15 minutes of the piano. I was so disappointed when we were walking out, because they sounded so good.   The atmosphere is really nice and loungy--BUT the mood lighting made reading the menu a little more straining than usual. The food was okay. I order the tri-tip dish off of the Ethiopian menu. It was overcooked and not as tender as I would've liked. I paired it with the honey wine, which was oh-so tasty.   tips: Come for a late dinner to enjoy the live music. Consider sitting at the couches rather than the tables. Also, the place looked pretty packed when I left, so plan ahead and make reservations.

CTpz4X42PQ0_VsPaK2itxA.review_text: Needless to say I was a bit skeptical at first, but the idea of exotic food and a live jazz band definitely made it intriguing. The ambiance of the room definitely had a grown romantic type feel to it. It was a little dim in there(with an exception of  a candle at your table), but the decor was classy and it had a very cozy dark feeling to it in my opinion. I wouldn't say it's a five star restaurant, but be prepared to break your bank just a tad bit.   We ordered the "Tibs wat" which is a sautéed prime beef simmered in berbere sauce with a touch of Nit'ir Kibe (Ethiopian purified butter), and also ordered the "Yasa tibs" which is a Sautéed catfish marinated in white wine and cooked with Berbere, scallions and tomatoes. To top it off we ordered a few glasses of ethopian honey wine, which I truly enjoyed. It has a very sweet taste, similar to moscato i'd say.  Ethiopian food was definitely a new experience for me because they use a moist type of bread called "Injera" in which you add the meats and roll it into a shape of your preference to eat. I would much rather prefer using "Naan"(indian bread), but no complaints here. The elderly lady taking our order was very nice and was also very informative. My personal favorite would probably have to be the sautéed catfish, it was delicious.   The live jazz band was definitely dope. They even did a Carlos Santana Cover and was very interactive with the crowd the whole time. Any thing with a saxophone get's play in my book (big Kenny G fan growing up!)

Xj0O2l0bp633ebmG468aZw.review_text: Awesome concept - delicious Ethiopian food and great jazz in a funky classy multicultural space - with outdoor seating even. Totally delicious and unique. Nice servers too. Go go go!

KnBi209G840c3GAqh3Ygmw.review_text: what a bizarre juxtaposition : ethiopian food + leather couches + live piano music.  we actually arrived and finished before the music started but even the decor of the place clashed with the food in a weird way.  i have a feeling if a piano player sat down to play "misty" we'd have gotten sucked into a black hole.  so the vibe was just a little too goofy, the place ties too many personalities together and thus ends with almost none...  i wonder if zelig ever eats here...  all that aside, the food is really excellent as are the drinks.  the seating is comfy and the ambient music very cool.

XHhK-RfjWmjysmD32-oo2g.review_text: great place to pretend you're cultured but not pretentious, with someone you may or may not want to talk to. cozy, intimate atmosphere w/ good jazz just loud enough that you can pretend you can't hear your dining companion if you're uncomfortable, but soft enough that you could talk if you'd like. the hostess was lovely and the tibs wat i ordered per her recommendation was delicious. next time i'd just go for the vegetarian menu though since it's a little pricey otherwise.  conclude your night by going to miyako's ice cream parlor afterwards and patronizing tom, a true gentleman and the ultimate homie

p5M9i50PBoRbaSgJmfC4dg.review_text: Vegetarian sampler is amazing. Live music and lovely hostess! I've come here many times and the ambience is really good for a date as well.   My friends had the lamb entree and they were really pleased as well.   Honey wine - sweet and I wouldn't recommend it with the food. Better with dessert or if you just want to taste it separately. Cocktails are made really well!  If you want to speak to your friends/date, I would suggest going earlier. This place fills up quickly. Else, make a reservation. Parking is easy - I usually pick up something from Safeway and park in the lot opposite.

rgAZ-3ebghnnL_2qhaQ6oQ.review_text: Celebrated a family members birthday here last night and had a great time! Sheba's had a live Latin Jazz band by the name of Latin Breeze playing and they were amazing!! The food was deliciously spicy, just how I like it. I tried the honey wine on the recommendation of a friend, but didn't like it as much as I expected to. The drink I did like was the Nile Collins. Talk about yum!   The only reason I'm giving Sheba's four stars is because of the space. It's not great for large groups (we were about a group on 12).

bU1Gf8_TUvI3IOYEe1rCHA.review_text: Went here for the first time yesterday and had a blast. Really great atmosphere with the live music and friendly staff.  The food was terrific and the mixed drinks were too. I would highly recommend this place for a date or a group of friends.

nFVRR1er0PBGNZMt2Qxg4w.review_text: We stumbled in here for a drink before a show at The Fillmore on a recent trip. I must say, they had a pretty decent live band and a nice, inviting atmosphere. The cocktails were delicious and the staff was friendly.   They were very busy, as it was a Friday night and Valentine's Day, so we just sat in a few chairs near the bar.

tFyy8UCB1NCPkHT7apiPOw.review_text: what a fantasticly lovely surprise.  this place has real soul.  my boyfriend and i were looking for ethiopian food near by and and decided to go here on a whim.  i felt immediately comfortable and charmed the moment we walked through the door.   it felt friendly like everyone there was family.  the decor was also warming and inviting.  we enjoyed the food very much--the veg sampler and the sombussa appetizer.  i especially liked the echo of the piano player's drumming foot  which could be felt across the floor.  the only waitress of the night  was cheery and attentive even though it was a very busy.   i have to say that the atmosphere here is one of the best i have ever experienced.   it was such a refreshing change to a lot of our usual fare.  to top it all off, not only was it the best ethiopian food i've had yet, the bill for an appetizer, shared veg plate, 3 beers, and dessert was only $35.  i would give this place six stars if i could.

eK5u7FePpvTTQpK5vijZcw.review_text: Great little chill spot. Little on the pricey side, but well worth it for the atmosphere. Went on a Tuesday and had some of the signature cocktails along with the vegetarian plate and it was a nice time.

a-CtXGkmHkaaXSvnOLFxOg.review_text: Sheba Lounge has a great interior and live jazz music!  The sheer colorful veils over the windows make you feel like you're in a dream.  It really transports you to some other place, and for that I would have given it a high score...  ... but I came here with my family to try Ethiopian food.  The style of eating is so fun - there's a huge platter in the center of the table that you share with everyone, and you pick everything up with this really spongy bread.  It was an interesting experience, but I didn't like the taste of the food at all.  It was almost sour.. even the bread.  Because this place was so unique (they even serve cucumber water), and they have a bar, and our waitress was really sweet, I wanted to give this place a 4 or 5... maybe Ethiopian food is just not for me, but unfortunately I don't think I'll be coming back here.

aXwZPx9LlqxSpx7gLKbGhA.review_text: I like their jazz live music here, but their ethiopian food is just okay.

ioKPuhSuNFvxCcsqSGKCZw.review_text: Here' s how to do Sheba:  Arrive at 7pm on a weeknight when a Jazz trio is playing.  Seize a table and spend some time looking over the menu.  Don't worry, the staff will give you as much time as you want to take.  At this time, Sheba will be largely empty.  At around 7:15, order some mushroom sambusas and a bottle of Tej (if you haven't had it before) or some beers (if you have).  At around 7:25, the sambusas and drinks will come out.  At 7:40, order some lentil sambusas and (if necessary), some more drinks.  The lentil sambusas are spicier; you'll need the drinks.  At 7:55, order a vegetarian sampler and an Ethiopian meat or fish dish.     Around 8:15, the band will start up.  Your food will also arrive, on a big round platter of injera, and you can dive into it.  You eat it with your fingers, using the provided injera bread; don't be afraid to ask for more, they'll bring it.  Refill beer or wine.  Around 9pm, you'll be finished with your food and the band will take their first break.   Order drinks and move to lounge chairs.  Listen to the band until 10pm, pay and leave.  Don't order mixed drinks, they don't have a real bartender.  Don't be in a hurry; they are not, and you're there to listen to the music.  Don't ask for a fork.  And don't order any of the "American" food.

6vZiVk2vyOVqkeNpcGHxfA.review_text: Is this not the cutest place ever?! My friend called me one night to get drinks. We wanted to go to a lounge down the street but they were not serving. Mind you, they were not CLOSED; we got in just fine. Only, when we were actually in, no one greeted us, no one was tending the bar, much less the entire lounge. We wandered here instead.   The Piano Player was playing. The lounge was dark. The white wine was cold and they had Dancing w/ the Stars on. When you watch Bristol Palin place 3rd (Don't get me started on the disaster that is the Palin family) while enjoying a nice glass of Riesling, nothing can go wrong. The place to go for a late night rendezvous with some good people. Just love-ly.

H7C9QEURfN12W8FGtqQLvg.review_text: We loved this place! The atmosphere is very warm and inviting. It's a wonderful place to relax after work. The food was delicious and the service was great. The live music (piano) provided a nice backdrop for intimate conversation. Would highly recommend this restaurant.

1t7k4zZREefIAJ3JcK_bpQ.review_text: Ate here after getting rejected from Rasselas. The food was good. We got a lentil sambusa and the spring mix salad which were both decent.  We also ordered the vegetarian sampler, doro tibs, and tibs wat which we all enjoyed. The service was slow, but we weren't in a rush and spent the time enjoying the piano playing. It was clear the one waitress that had to serve us, 2 other tables, and make drinks for everyone at the bar was busting ass so we didn't complain. I saw the chef  come out and talk to another table that was unhappy with one of the dishes they had gotten. She seemed genuinely concerned and brought them another dish that they were happy with.  All in all it was an enjoyable experience, even though the waitress accidentally ran my friend's card and charged him with another table's bill. The piano player was great, he was friendy and interacted with the crowd. I'd come back again.

N70UuS5UwR4KEi3Sw73duQ.review_text: Sheba's is my spot for beers and Ethiopian and a flute of mumm.  This place is delicious and the people who run it are great.  The music is usually very good and it's rarely too packed.  Superior Ethiopian and a great, completely non-pretentious scene.    Thank you Sheba!

2k1t3zei7AweqhSZ6k-Wmg.review_text: As a middle easterner, it pains me to say that this place might have cooked the best lentil dish I've ever had in my life. I love Ethiopian food, and this was among, if not the best, I've had. I stuck to vegetarian items, sharing with friends, and while the lentils were the best, everything was above my expectations. Do yourself a favor and make sure to get an order of the sambussas to start.

txWFXIMtDUaheiePKnAQyg.review_text: I have a love-hate relationship with Ethiopian food . . . it is so good but that damned injera always expands in my stomach and makes me feel like I've eaten a moose.  Feeling phsyically ill always follows Ethiopian.  But I just can't help going back for more because it's so damn good.  The food here was yummy, especially the tibs wat, doro tibs, and red lentil thing on the vegeterian sampler.  It seemed spicier than other Ethiopian I've had, which I was a fan of.    I know this place is technically a "lounge" so what did I expect, but it was honestly sort of annoying to eat from a deep lounge chair and small stools.  Especially when you're eating family style and sharing everything.  Even if you fancy yourself a lounge, if you're serving food like that, you should have at least a couple of regular tables and chairs, right?  So that's a minus one star.

KKaYfZb7p-h_QK9P5lAy6Q.review_text: If you like great lounges then this is the place for you. Don't let the neon fool you this place has a chill seating area with comfy couches, a fire place, full bar, and tastey Ethiopian food. They have really great bands that play and London Street is one of my favorite. Not a good place to have a conversation, but a great spot to hang in and get cozy with your date.

x9sWo_n5PVJKUKaLOPLjkw.review_text: This place rocks.  It's beautiful inside, really wonderful atmosphere.  The food is great, and VERY reasonably priced.  People who work there are beautiful and fun and, though they may not always be the most masterful of their trade, they have great attitudes and make the experience highly enjoyable.  Full bar, wide range of food offered.  Here's the kicker: the owners are Ethiopian so a lot of the food has a VERY tasty and unique Ethiopian slant.  There are at least 3 different menus I remember: very tasty lounge-type food (pomegranate drumettes, drunken shrimp, pita chips, etc.), regular dinner menu (pasta, burgers, all that good stufff made better) and Ethiopian dinner menu, which is a rare and wonderful experience to say the least. Yes! Do It! Check it out! Bring a date, you will get laid!!

gfaFWB_oahHrZ2R_XFR_fg.review_text: I lived in the neighborhood for for years. Whenever I'd travel out of town for more than a week, my first meal back home had to be at Sheba! The veggie sampler, catfish, and tibs wat are my favorites.

IqZSZvY8UXqZK2C_YWTOmw.review_text: Mid-August my girlfriends and I decided we all wanted to try out Ethiopean food. After seeing great reviews on yelp and the live music, we were sold on Sheba.  We were all so impressed! The food is fantastic, so flavorful! I am very much of a eat meater but the vegetarian platter is delicious - the lentils are out of this world.  The jalapeno spiced dish (lamb) was a bit too spicy for me but all the other things we tried made us beg for more.  The appetizers were so, so good.  We tried the cheesecake brownie adn we loved it.  All of us gave their martinis an A+.   The atmosphere is awesome with live music and loungy chairs.  The latin band was impressive! But I must say what really made it special was Chef  Netsanet - she explained the dishes and what the Ethiopean way of eating is.  She was very patient with all of our questions and treated us like family.  So, to summarize food is great, chef is helpful and attentive, the music is fantastic.  Is it perfect? No - the place is a bit cozy, tight and sodas are $4.00 with $1.50 refills. But I definitely will go back - but will stick to water, no sodas.   Enjoy everyone!

0aEsYrwrBHE4LRgvv-A2yg.review_text: Sheba's.  Thank you for being in my neighborhood.  How I love your food.  How I love your music.  I am addicted to your fireplace, which my shoddy apartment lacks.  I lust for your vegetarian sampler that speaks to me in sweet nothings in my dreams.  Your music is the window dressing to looking out on a beautiful day.  Your staff doesn't know my name, but they always ask me how I'm doing and know what I like.  You even offer a TV in the event some sports snippet is on that I need to see while I imbibe or eat.    Thank you for being there for me, Sheba.

-1K_fvr2IMtnHI7mbGaMiw.review_text: Music was great, food was great.  Nice atmosphere, friendly service.     First time eating a this cuisine, but this is how i eat at home often.

EZDA0JnQXTSmUGMeDNaYxw.review_text: I've been here a number of times, and have found it to be one of the most romantic, well-priced, delicious places in san francisco. Get the vegetarian sampler and lamb, enough food for two. Enjoy the standing bass. Get romantic.

I1m56_mTW98KVyU_COBS8A.review_text: Stopped here after work for a quick drink.  Only had drinks, didn't try the food.  The Soloman's Julep was minty and refreshing.  The Harrar Cooler was sweet and went down very easy.  And the Abyssinia Storm had a nice contrasting of flavors between the rum and ginger beer.  Along with some background piano, it was a nice closer to the evening.  Maybe some night I'll stopped and try something to eat.

G66J4Z0l0kXBKBhbgqm1IA.review_text: Went to Sheba Lounge last night (Saturday)...  We made a reservation at 8pm, but got there a little late, the hostess had no problem accomodating us.  We were seated on some comfy couches by the fireplace when the lead singer of the jazz band started singing.  Hello?!  Wow, that lady has a soulful, sexy, and smooth voice.    Dammit!  Love the coziness of the fireplace, but we can't see the band from where we are sitting, furthermore, the vocalist's mike was not turned up enough...I wasn't able to hear the lyrics clearly enough.  So I got up to stand in a more ideal location for a bit while we were waiting for the food so I could watch the band and the action.  They were really great.  We ordered family style and the Ethiopian entrees were quite good.  (I could have done without the appetizers, the teriyaki meatballs and french fries aren't very Ethiopian style).  After dinner we were full, warm and comfy, chilling by the fire and relaxing to the music.  Good times.  Then we had a cruise ship moment...This super old couple got up to dance and mack to the music, uh, thanks but no thanks.  That was the one wack moment of the nite.  All in all, the food was pretty good, but the atmosphere and music were tops!  A must visit if you want to have a chill and enjoyable evening, the Ethiopian food was a cherry on top.  We'll be back.

qwcONrqv8cdBdt_SiqSUdA.review_text: We went to this place with friends and we found it to be very interesting. Ambience was great, service was good, food I can't say I didn't eat something better, but presentation was A+. Everything we ordered came with a side of a salad and we were all impressed by it. The samosa snacks were hella good.  There was a guy playing the piano, but was not too loud so didn't bother us at all.  So overall I would definitely recommend this place and I am sure we'll go back.

OD9TngbyG2R7oOVzIKRluw.review_text: The food was great I am not a big fan of spicy food but it was just enough, well done. Service was attentive and the staff is very pleasant.  The decor is better on the lounge side with a fireplace, than in the dining room. The music is very eclectic, I mean, I didn't expect to hear slasa at an Ethiopian place...Prices are quite reasonnable.  I was very bummed to go there on a Friday night and to leave at 9.30pm without hearing piano at all, it is a "piano lounge" after all...   If I was to go back I would stay at the lounge and have food there.

1jbpuREwZ8dpciuyzBOaNA.review_text: This was my first time eating Ethiopian food and it was amazing. The servers were very friendly and helpful, despite the fact that there were 16 people in my party who each had their own needs. The suggestions the waitresses gave us were great. We had enough food for everyone and didn't overspend. You must try whatever the lentil dish is in the vegetarian platter. It is TO DIE FOR.  From the outside I would never think to go in this place but the decor inside is very chic. It wasn't too loud. Dimly lit to a nice degree, not a "I can't see my food" degree. I would definitely go here again.

uSCYNal_CJDPGBYUAenyoA.review_text: Quality Ethiopian food without a linoleum floor! Still Sheba is a mixed bag.  The dishes were delicious, but the injera was not that great and not as good as I have had.   The service was friendly, but the dessert was an awful hodgepodge of a tiramisu. I do know better than that of course; I didn't expect an Ethiopian piano bar to have mastered tiramisu. But it was a date & a special night, which calls for dessert even it's imperfect. I'll eat tiramisu from Walgreens mind you, but I was annoyed that they put something that wasn't at least a passable imitation on the menu.   And the incense was over whelming (at first). They seemed like they might have been getting ready for a busy night and we were there early. Maybe they burn it early and tapper it off when more people are there.    There wasn't any of the live piano music going on, but Sheba still makes a great spot for an easy meal.  And it's among your best affordable, quick options before a show at the Fillmore.

r9VkVP_4d2_KMHA9ZN2c6w.review_text: Last night was about popping two cherries with one stone.  After filling our bellies with some yummy Sophie's crepes, MD and I both agreed to try something new.  Ethiopian it was, and I'm so glad Yelp didn't let us down this time.  After a nice trek around the block cus Yelp maps got me all confuzzled, we walked in, took a look around wondering where the host/hostess was, then discovered that the host was also the bartender.  He let us sit anywhere we wanted, as the place was hardly packed.  (It got super packed later on in the evening)  At first we were going to sit in the plush armchairs adjacent to the roaring fireplace, but then we looked at the coffee table and were like "that won't be fun to eat at".  So we got a table instead.  The decor is really nice and the lighting dim - just the way I like it.  Our server also ended up being the bartender/host too.  That man ran the whole place on his lonesome until about eight o;clock!  Talk about a one man show!  And he was good too!  We didn't have to wait that long for anything.  For food, we opted for the crab rolls, the rosemary and balsamic sea bass, and the doro tibbs.  All were super good!  And with our waiter/bartender/host/everything else under the sun, our cherry popping experience was amazing.  The only thing missing was for the guy to also start playing the piano and hopping back into the kitchen to cook our meal.  So, 5 stars goes to you, kind sir.  You made everything spectacular!

b8GIQtDZCEYIpSqNnaQqTQ.review_text: I would have never imagined a Piano lounge to be the kinds to serve Ethiopian food! And well, I never thought a Piano lounge would play jazz and soul music. It is a very novel idea.  Located a block away from Dosa on Fillmore, Sheba isn't tough to miss. When you walk in, you are greeted by an ambiance that is both, romantic (if you are on a date) and upbeat (if you are out with your friends). We made a reservation for 6 on a Saturday evening and we ended up getting the "quiet" little corner by the fireplace near the entrance. The reason I said "quiet" is because it is far from quiet. Not an ideal location if you want to enjoy the music and a meal. The drums that beat are in your ears. Makes it tough for conversation. So I am guessing that a better spot in the lounge would be by the bar. The reason I didn't give it 5 stars was because the music seems really loud for small interiors.  We ordered 2 plates of the spicy lentil sambusa and 3 vegetarian samplers with Injera bread. The food was really good. 5 stars! We also ordered a bottle of the honey wine for our table and relished it.  You will find potheads lurking by the bar! Or maybe it was just a one night thing.  I'll definitely be going back, this time, a little farther from the music :o)

D3ZMD1KEub2EjPkdpW9EvA.review_text: We came in to listen to live music. The service is really slow! I was able to write this review while still waiting for my check.  We asked to sit in the lounge area but only tables were available. They said it'd be ok to just sit and listen to music and drink. They pretty much forced a friend to order a drink. I didn't see the problem with her just relaxing with us since almost everyone got drinks and we got some shared appetizers.   Anyways, its over priced and the service is really aggressive. I would not suggest this place for anyone. Ugh  Also we showed up around 10:30-11pm because the live band was supposed to play until 12am. they ended a little before 11:30pm. If we knew that was the case, we would have avoided this whole situation.   *** The happy hour they have posted on yelp is not accurate. When we got there, the server told us only BOTTLES of wine were on the happy hour menu, not by the glass.

H7rSou2_032kC0LD2bWDvQ.review_text: My first time ever eating Ethiopian food, although my great grandmother is Ethiopian. I Have to say this was an A-MAZ-ING first!   I chose this place based on the proximity to The Independent which I visited Saturday night, and it's Yelp reviews. From the moment I walked in and was greeted by the gorgeous host (I think she may have been the owner because I saw her picture on a poster inside), not a lesbian, but she seriously was really beautiful, to the minimal wait for our food and the great live jazz I was highly impressed. AWESOME ambiance!   I decided, again based on a Yelp review and my love of blue cheese, to order the Meatballs covered in Blue Cheese as a starter.... ORGASMIC! I made my BF eat them s-l-o-w-l-y and kept telling him to "Savor the flavor" lol Then I ordered the Gomen, which is collard greens, also super delicious! It came with a small side salad and Injera (bread). My BF ordered the Tri Tip which he found ORGASMIC as well! I know this because he kept moaning with each bite, plus I kept stealing bites of his food. For drinks I tried the Honey Wine and the Suimui Rice Vodka Cosmo, both were REALLY good!   This place is a must for me! I have to make this part of my dining routine each month. The staff is friendly, the food is great, the ambiance is wonderful, what more could you ask for in a restaurant. 5 stars hands down!   NOTE: The prices on the website are not updated. Some meals are actually $2 more, so where it says $12.50 they were $14.50.   PARKING: I was unaware of this and wish I had know in advance so as not to waste time and gas looking for parking. There is a public 24hr lot on Eddy between Steiner & Fillmore.

srj-v0WSYa-1gpmffbeypg.review_text: This place was such a big hit for our group of 3 tonight!  From my healthy(er) eating partner to my mom who is trying to avoid eating meat and to my big flavor loving self, the place made all the check list!  We ordered the steak tartare (their version is warmed up and has a side of Mexican-type crumbled cheese), vegetarian sampler and their lamb.  Their vegetarian platter and their lamb has just the right amount of spices to enhance the dish but not to make us worry about their aftereffects.  The service is warm and friendly.  And, as already noted by many, the atmosphere is intimate.  We would definitely be back!!

cCeCQxErE9ToaQQBEVFuFA.review_text: My wonderful boyfriend decided for his birthday he wanted Ethiopian. now, it was my job to find a spot. out of the handful of restaurants in the city, the idea of it having live music seemed like this might be the one.  pretty close to where we live, hopped on the bus and a short block away the neon lights made his smile light up. we had a table reserved, but after him looking around and talking to the hostess, we grabbed seats right in the center, coffee table and big comfy chairs were our new home for the night. we pulled up the candle and now it was a romantic yet chill spot to enjoy some food.  i'll be honest, the server seemed a little slow at getting drinks or clearing, but we were having such an enjoyable time it didn't bother us.  started out with the Spicy Lentil Sambussa With Tangy Dip. the dip was like a cilantro chutney and Wow.  then for main course, we got the Vegetarian Sampler that had salad greens, Gomen (collard greens), Kik Alicha (yellow split peas), Mesir Wat (lentils), Atakilt Kilikil (fresh spicy cabbage) all served on top of Injera, with the center having one of the meats- doro tibs (chicken) and  Beg Alecha (lamb) on the side in a bowl.   Rip a piece of Injera, scoop of some eats, and pop it your mouth. we devoured the dish and it was pretty huge. i think there should have been more spice with the chicken, but to be honest, now sure how hot i could have handled.  the only thing that i would have wanted different is the desserts. Now, I'm not going to lie, because the warm cheesecake brownie was DIVINE, but i would have liked to try some crazy Ethiopian dessert..something has to exist or be made up.   And this band, Bohemian Knuckleboogie, is awesome. They put their heart and soul into playing their music, and we felt like we were the only ones there.

H_yUP8iG0_4dbN-Jsa5IMw.review_text: I actually found this place randomly while walking around with my girlfriend looking for some food.  The food was decent.  I had never had Ethiopian food before and can't say I'm a huge fan, but they have several options.   I must say though that this was a perfect date place.  We bought a bottle of wine and listened to the fantastic jazz band playing that Thursday night.  I highly recommend checking this place out and having a relaxing evening of jazz.

YKZIkrW5H4F3iWOBJPNneQ.review_text: Sheba is a great spot for live music great atmosphere including a fire place and piano i love this place the owner is awesome and the meatballs are out or this world!

iAgeUjprA28AQDa80mDuTg.review_text: UPDATE: they now have live music! this place is going to be packed once Yoshi's and the jazz museum open up across the street. can't wait for them to really bring the jazz era, BRING THE COOL BACK to the fillmore.   ********  AMBIANCE: very nice. fireplace. really nice bar area with sofas. not yet set up for live music but there is sophisticated jazz playing in the background.   DRINK ONE MUST ORDER: pomegranate martini.   FOOD: mixed feeling. small dry portions. but really flavorful and tasty.    STAFF: attentive and friendly. i think the owners run the place too.

lc1wSn-TQPPmLsAbjFW7Ww.review_text: First time i came here was for the jazz. Good music, packed but not crazy. Came back recently and had the food - great food, great service. Would recommend it for a chill evening.

S9N1RgpiBIkFTZi39tFYJw.review_text: The food was fine.  Flavorful, a little on the spicy side.  Good.  The service was ridiculously bad.  We had a reservation for a big group.  We got there on time.  They had us get drinks in the lounge. . . eventually we were getting hungry and asked to be seated.  That's when we were told that they had given away our table while we were in the bar (at their request)!   20 people squeezing into about 8 overstuffed lounge chairs around a very low table tyring to eat dinner was not a pretty sight.

1SjayTzcMgOiy0iIUtwvHA.user_location: West San Jose, San Jose, CA
1SjayTzcMgOiy0iIUtwvHA.review_text: Great music  Lovely decor  Great service  Best euthopian food in sf Loved drink choices  Good place to spend evening with friends

lxOcZ1VZ58nSCFgcunecjw.review_text: I stopped by here for a drink before the show at the Fillmore but I would have rather just gone inside early and gotten a drink there.  There were some weird folks there and the service and drinks were nothing to write home about.

Rl-6DoFWV-kJBiaRIr4U2Q.review_text: I went here for the first time.. It was great.. Yummy vegetarian platter.. Nice atmosphere.. Very laid back.. Will return again..

XO-YWxq9Y8fY5u7OYXERdw.review_text: So I went here on a date and it was nice. We had a bottle of wine and the food was decent. The best part was the music, the pianist was very good and he played a variety of songs. I'll definitely be back but probably for appetizers and drinks.

JGnqasIkGMLfSejt7mw9qQ.review_text: WARNING: this review is based solely on the service. I did not get a chance to try the food.  My boyfriend and I wanted to do a date night and this place looked legit. I'm a fan of Ethiopian food and any restaurant that offers live music gets my attention. I was also excited about Sheba because of the reviews. So we made reservations for a Saturday night. When we arrived, we were seated at a table for 2. The tables were really close to one another but that was OK, the atmosphere and ambience were romantic and intimate. Our waiter handed us our menus and literally 2 min later, the host came to us and told us that there was a mistake, and we were actually supposed to be seated at a COMMUNAL TABLE near the piano.   My first thought: WTH??! Isn't it obvious that we are a couple and that we're not looking to share a table with another group (these 6 ladies were really nice though)? So they moved us to the table where there were 6 other women sitting and chatting up a storm. We were put on one side of the table. I was so mad and disappointed at this point. I'm all for "the more, the merrier" if I had a group of girlfriends with me but it was very clear that my boyfriend and I were not looking to buddy up with other patrons. We wanted to leave at that point but felt like it was wrong to do so after they seated us (don't know why we felt guilty--Sheba messed up, not us). We decided to order drinks and looked on Yelp for other restaurants nearby so we can have our dinner there.   So as a tip/warning to couples who are making reservations, please state it clearly that you will like your own table. I don't know any restaurant that will put a couple at a communal table. And if they were going to do so, please let us know beforehand so we can politely decline and leave before getting seated. Also, if you don't have a table for two, tell us when we are making the reservation so we know what to expect.  I'm giving Sheba two stars because the food that the women who we were sitting with smelled really good. I'm sure this place has impeccable food, just really bummed we weren't able to try it. I'm still contemplating whether or not to go back after this failed experience.

VwyEYKy7FSOV1guPRNXByA.review_text: This is the Fillmore Jazz district, plenty of jazz to choose from and Sheba hits the mark. Cool jazz, small venue and no entrance fee just order a couple of drinks and you're good. Shebas is Ethiopian owned it has a laid back vibe.  When you enter the band is right there. You can literally shake the band members hand as you walk in, a very nice welcome. We found a spot on a leather love seat, we ordered a glass of wine & cocktail, service was fast. I wish restaurants as nice as Sheba would serve wine in a nice wine glass, not what was placed before us. They have a decent wine list and the stemware should reflect this. The excellent band (pianist playing a baby grand, bassist, sax, drummer) played two songs when we got there then took a break, but played again. I wanted to stay all nite but alas our suburban town was calling us, regretfully we had to go. I love this neighborhood, full of music venues and eateries that stay open late. Satisfaction!

y8maq3HN41LdPDoqS3-JSw.review_text: I've been to a few Etheopean places in SF and Sheba's has thus far been my favorite! And bonus, it's also a piano jazz lounge!   The spices are definately fresh here, and while service is a little slow, they are super friendly. I love eating off mega plates with a spread of spicy foods. Add one cocktail and Mr paino player and you got yourself a pleasent little evening. I have yet to hang out in the lounge area but those plush chairs and fireplace look very inviting!

0RwIQ8MU-VEsYmZpT_v1VQ.review_text: I come here pretty often!  One of my buddies lives very close, so we usually come here to stop by and have a quick IPA before heading out!  It hasn't been till recently that I had the chance to try their food!  The food here is fantastic. Some of the dishes I tried:  Steak Tartar - Definitely not to be missed. The savory raw meat combined with exotic blend of spices makes this dish so tasty, exotic, and delicious.  The sea bass special - The fish was so fresh; the meat almost melts like butter in your mouth.  Also the spices and sauces added a tasty and spicy dimension to the fish. Truly a fantastic dish that will awaken your taste buds.  Also on certain days, they have a live band playing jazz which is always a plus for me. A word of mention must be given to the manager; she is such a friendly and hospitable person; always treating me and the rest of my buds as if we were family!  So if you're in the mood for something more exotic and mouthwatering at the same time, I highly recommend this place.

jztXMn-zngWJU2dd7-bO-g.review_text: What a gem of a place! The food is off the chart! The spices they use are correct, and the healthy food leaves no room for guilt. They have great musicians and the staff is so friendly and helpful. This is THE place to go with that special someone, or for a night out with friends. I highly recommend this lovely place !!

fW971v8bt2_dzbiUCZ_7UQ.review_text: REVISED 11/9/07  I rarely revise a review, but my experiences here have steadily improved since I gave it a meager 3 stars earlier this year.  Sheba Lounge is cozy and warm, and comfortable place to be after a long day at work.  The soft lighting and pleasant service really puts me at ease.  On top of that, they have musicians there pretty often--I saw Ricardo playing piano tonight and that man can PLAY!  He doesn't use notes and knew both songs my sister requested.    The food here is excellent, and the owner is sooooo nice!  And walking here from the Lower Haight really only takes 15 minutes AT MOST.    FYI: They let my sister rent it out for a crazy party awhile back...drag queens everywhere...and were totally accommodating.   If you're looking to host an event, inquire within.

NDW7SjtgMTzwuZSWpq7i7g.review_text: Decent food, service was great. Two of our group were unhappy with what they ordered and they were willing to remove it from our tab. The drinks were great, chill environment too. Even though the band said "they couldn't play the happy birthday song" for someone from our group, they put it together on the spot and did it well too!

wqoXYLWmpkEH0YvTmHBsJQ.review_text: Very cool spot for a date. They have an event schedule on their website you should double check before you commit to going. You can grab some 2.5-3 star Ethiopian food (compared to Assab on Geary) while you listen to some live entertainment. The staff was very friendly and the spot is pretty romantic. Seems like the spot attracts a bunch of couples on dates and a crew of regulars that sit together in the front.

Z9bOjahuxvMju3mO3ac9_g.review_text: this place is sick!  i didn't actually have much food or drink.. but the ambiance was nice. we had the pomegranate meatballs, ethiopian espresso (served cold), and even got some ethiopian samusas on the house.  good, lounge-like music, a nice place to relax with your friends.  also great because its right outside my place.

WtZyXabdl1bP1XJ7vQRG-A.review_text: This is my third time here.  The first time I had a good time chilling and getting drinks with a big group of friends.  The second, I had dinner with my sister and it was solid Ethiopian food.  However, after this third experience, I don't think I would ever come back to Sheba's Piano lounge for anything other than dinner.  I can't tell if my palate has become more refined over the past year or if the standards of their kitchen and bar have gone down, but I was here with a group and tried 3 different drinks and 3 desserts and every single one was nasty.  I take no pleasure in ragging on them because the proprietor is a lovely lady and very accommodating in trying to get everyone seated and comfortable, but they really need to get a new bartender and dessert chef.  We tried the Sheba Cosmo, Harrar Cooler and Solomon's Julep and all the cocktails had this sickly-sweet, cough syrup flavour that made me nauseous after a couple sips.  My sister's Trumer Pilsner was fine, of course.  We also got dessert, to hedge our bets, and I was dismayed to find that the baklava was dry, the vanilla ice-cream with fried brioche had blatantly icy (not creamy) ice-cream, and when I bit into the fried brioche (which was basically crispy toast) I found a piece of plastic in there!  To their credit, they graciously replaced the dish with tiramisu, but that was not much better.  The tiramisu tasted like a clash of strong (again, nauseating) flavors rather than a smooth, creamy whole.  You'll usually find me licking the dessert plate but I ended up letting all three of these go to waste.  Based on these 6 samples, I cannot recommend any of the desserts or mixed drinks on their menu.  And finally, the live music (this is for the jazz trio that played last Saturday and I understand they're not the regular band) was nice and atmospheric, but not anything special.  My sister and I were thoroughly unimpressed as we have seen much better jazz performances even at her school's local dive.  I may not know much about music, but even I could discern that they were musically lazy, because for most of the performance it just sounded like the pianist + drums + bass were all playing repetitive background patterns and nobody was leading a melody.  Their one redeeming song was "Summertime", when they got a saxophonist (who joined only at the end of the set) to carry the melody.  Note to self:  If you ever do come back again, try to check that there's a good band playing, and only get dinner, beer or wine.

1AN5MAUzfW5qqwsvxvQyuQ.review_text: Ok so crab appetizer thing is the shit!! Have to get next time too!!! Cause here will be a next time for sure! Then we got chicken and some other ass shit and we ate with our hands and just beast mode the shit out of that plate! Lol it's a great place to take someone conservative and loosen up that top button!!! Drinks are great and live jazz??!!! Ahhh gentrification has it's perks!

CRLA264qZO-IxB2gQOnJmg.review_text: Yes, please...  Chill venue hosting soulful music warm decor beautiful people and lovely local talent

L569rUmLrr37yo1QOdwZqw.review_text: I went back and got better service from what appeared to be the owner. And only tried one dish which was quite nice.

Hl1f4VO0a9KdGrrRCPMqSA.review_text: I stumbled on this place a while ago and was so delighted by it I keep bring people back. Really good food and a super nice staff.

OYNOgAFJzp3gdpRMY4JJWQ.review_text: Worst service I've ever had! We had a large group and our waitress had the chance to make a considerable tip, but instead she proceeded to just drop off our check after the first round and FULL DRINKS were still on the table. We asked why she did this 2 hours before last call, and she simply stated she was closing out and going home. Okay! Understandable... She wants to go home. I get it. But pass off the tab to the waitress replacing you! She gave us attitude the entire time we were there, and never picked up the check she prematurely delivered. We complained to the manager and all he did was say he'd have a talk with her. He didn't apologize or anything. Avoid this place if you're looking to have a good night. The only thing you'll find here is frustration and shitty drinks.

__Ksf1CCgaKdS3Gi5f6PcQ.review_text: 4 of us went for dinner two wks ago on a Fri and the place was full - fortunately we had made reservations so had a table near the group performing that night.   Had the lentil platter, doro tibs + sea bass - all of which were quite good indeed! The only complain was that the servings were not v.large -eg. the doro tibs came with no accompanying sides at all. Also had the champagne cocktail which was quite good.  It was nice to be in place with good food plus live music without hving to sacrifice one for the other.

yhMT_nlpa7ox1Yo8QMUoJA.review_text: This place does not disappoint. I am so glad to have returned here.  For a table of 4, we ordered:  Sirloin Sambussa Doro Tibs (Chicken) - My favorite! Lega Tibs (Sirloin Strips)  Vegetarian Sampler Wine GreyGoose and Tonic - YEAH!!  $125.00 + Tip.   Everything was well prepared. Service was excellent! Live Music was fun. The atmosphere here is fun and laid back and relaxed.  I still do not have the guts to try Kitfo. Maybe someday...

UK-nkxH4s9Vb08jdlJ8pKA.review_text: aah, the spicy lentil sambussa is mindblowing!!! the ambience is super chill, good live music each time. Once we had a young girl singing blues and next a jazz band. we got the vegetarian platter both times and it's a good amount for two! The cocktails are good as well. Though I have to say, it's really cramped in there, with little space even for the waiters to walk around.

2zhCKmkxo7nmDhtxQL0uew.review_text: This is my favorite Ethiopian resturant and i use to live near little Ethiopia in Los Angeles. The food is delicious i always get the vegetarian sampler. They usually have Ethiopian beer called king George which is pretty good. At night they have live jazz. I always go there with my mom and/or dad when they come to visit.

PJGD7zKksRjePnAIppFoiQ.review_text: Pro: nice live jazz music.  Con: mediocre drinks. Bad service. My bf and I sat at the bar and it took us 15 minutes to get the attention of the bartender. We were there for about 30 minutes and in that time, the bartenders broke three glasses.

dh9Z73_QZpsXXmO9id31cg.review_text: If you've read my reviews, you know I'm a huge fan of ethiopian food. So I only had one meal left in San Fran before I hit my plane, and wanted to sample the local ethiopian. I had this one place in mind, and told the cabbie, but he then told me he was ethiopian and that Sheba was way better.  I got the Sirloin with Jalapeno in a white wine sauce and it was not a stew, but more like a pile of dry meat with some onions in it. It also didn't come with any sides. I don't like ethiopian places that don't let you do a combination because they're quite boring, and this one was 100% boring.  In addition, I ate early, and even though the restaurant was full the insisted on filling the two tables around me with the only two other people in the restaurant. I hate that.

7iF7pwyURXpiAVuaDJ_Vhw.review_text: I went here last night with my boyfriend and family for my birthday, having no idea what to expect. We arrived at about 7pm, i.e. too early for the jazz, and I was surprised that they were instead playing very odd 80s synth music, which was amusingly out of place. The atmosphere was great otherwise, very comfy and dimly lit and cozy. My boyfriend and I shared the vegetarian sampler platter, which was disappointing only in that it left us wanting much, much more. Everything was ridiculously delicious, and I could eat a vat of the spicy yellow split pea dish.   We will definitely be returning again, for significantly bigger portions :3

MjCIBCRp7p4B_ITMWDpKzQ.review_text: I came here yesterday for my roommate's goodbye party/dinner. She made a reservation for a large group (I think it was about 15 of us), so when we got there, there was already a very large table set up for us ready to go. There was a live jazz band performing in the restaurant which was wonderful! The atmosphere was beautiful, relaxed, and aesthetically pleasing. There were places you could lounge by the fireplace in a couch if you just came to enjoy the music and a drink, as well as plenty of table seating for dinner.   As guests from our group arrived, the bartender promptly brought over pitchers of water, and took our drink orders. It took a really long while for our waitress to finally come take our orders, but I'm assuming it's because she thought we'd want to relax and enjoy the music/company for a while.   My friends on my side of the table decided we'd all order something different and share, as none of us have ever had Ethiopian food before. I ordered the lega tibs which are pieces of wine-marinated sirloin with Ethiopian spices.  It took a very long time for our food to get out. The other half of our table received their food orders before our half did, which is understandable considering we were such a large group. It's hard to get all the dishes out at once. We waited about 10 minutes after they got theirs for ours to get there. I believe we waited about 45 minutes to an hour to get our food after ordering (again, understandable as we were such a large group).  Ingera is a very moist bread-like substance that Ethiopians use to eat their food (instead of utensils), so we were given a basket with that. I wasn't a huge fan of the moistness. My friends compared it to pancakes. You're supposed to pick up a portion of the dish with the ingera, roll up, and eat. It was a fun and different experience. My lega tibs were so delicious, and I'd say it was definitely my favorite out of all the dishes we ordered.  We ate everything, cleaned our plates, it was so tasty. I'd recommend doing the family style like my friends and I did so you can try a little bit of everything. I also recommend this place for large groups. The staff was very patient, helpful, and kind.

CyUR1uFKpFcIP3NPGbFSwA.review_text: Jazz piano was great played songs we knew but not songs that are over done. The owner understood it was our first time eating Ethiopian food and brought out extra dishes so we could better understand the food. Sheba is a must stop.
